intro: Linaria dalmatica, commonly known as the Dalmatian toadflax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow-orange flowers with two lips, typical of the Scrophulariaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain regions.
